intro: Vesicaria, commonly known as the blister grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive bladelike shape. The flowers are small and white or pale green, often clustered in umbels. Vesicaria species are often found in disturbed soils and are adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
